result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G. Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:37 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC/MH)
Defendant Robert G. Wallace in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock submits AMENDED information; Service of Amended Information Admitted; Reading Waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment & family care; to commence 2/28/15 by 6:00 pm
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443; due in 90 days; non-payment results in a 9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

On Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment & family care; to commence consecutive to Count #1
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443; due in 90 days. non-payment results in a 9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
Recess: 9:58 am
Defendants response to State's demand for discovery
States notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant
of the 10/3/14 Preliminary Hearing held before the Honorable Judge Neal Nettesheim
Defendant's AMENDED//Acknowledgment of review by the  court
Jury trial on February 16 & 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on February 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on February 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 2:26 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert G. Wallace in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered 
Counsel agree 2 days are needed for trial; Court/Counsel discuss scheduling. Atty Witt indicates that FSSC date of 2/10/15, is not available. Parties agree to 2/11/15 for FSSC
Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
Recess: 2:32 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 2/11/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 2/16-17/15 at 8:30 am  - Send notices

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 8:36am. [MK]
Defendant Robert G. Wallace in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Officer Daniel Hefty -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock 
--cross examination by Attorney Witt
Brief closing argument given by Attorney Witt.

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Wallace committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Arraignment.
ADA Shock requests that Arraignment be scheduled on a future date.
The Court continues the bond.
recess 8:53am.

NEXT:  Arraignment on 10/24/14 at 2:30pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 9:00 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert G. Wallace in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Witt: Case has not yet been resolved, requests matter be set for preliminary hearing
ADA Shock: No objection
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Shock indicates that there has not been any bond violations
Court continues bond; Atty Witt confirms waiver of time limits
Recess: 9:03 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 10/3/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on September 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 27, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 9:31 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert G. Wallace in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No ingestion of alcohol to the point of legal impairment to drive
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No contact with BLR & FJC as named in the complaint

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 8/27/14 at 2:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 9/12/14 at 9:00 am - Send notices
General objection to the use of hearsay at the preliminary hearing filed by Attorney Witt
